main event: A bright white object, similar to a star, moved eastward across the sky in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on September 4, 1965.
interesting points: Multiple witnesses reported seeing the object, which was described as round, round with a trail, clear shaped, and irregular in appearance.
The object was observed for around 1 hour, with reports of it being stationary, moving, and disappearing vertically.
An 'ice crystal cloud' reflecting city lights was detected, which may have been the source of the sightings.
On September 15, 1965, seven stationary, pale full moon-colored, perfectly round objects in an 'M' formation were observed in the Pittsburgh area.
The September 15 sighting was likely caused by a reflection or mirage related to the position of the sun and clouds.
result: Likely explained as reflections or mirages, though some aspects remain unexplained.
sighted object: A bright white object similar to a star, as well as seven pale, round objects in an 'M' formation.
photographs: No photographs included in the reports
